Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class Lobby

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.Lobby
public class Lobby extends Object
The Lobby class is a singleton that manages the creation of new ClientHandlers, new Controllers and new Games. It also manages the nickname uniqueness of the players

    • addClient

      public void addClient(Socket socket)
      The addClient method tries to create a new ClientHandler object with the given socket, to create the corresponding thread and to make it start
      Parameters:
      socket - the Socket connected to the client for which to create the ClientHandler

    • createAvailableGamesMessage

      public AvailableGamesMessage createAvailableGamesMessage(String nickname)
      The createAvailableGamesMessage creates an AvailableGamesMessage object with the data of the available games for the player with the given nickname
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player
      Returns:
      an AvailableGamesMessage object with the data of the available games for the player with the given nickname

    • createNewGameController

      public NewGameController createNewGameController(String nickname, int numOfPlayers, boolean expertMode)
      the method createNewGameController tries to create a new game with the given parameters and the controller bound to it
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player that wants to create the game
      numOfPlayers - the number of players of the game to be created
      expertMode - true if the game to be created will be an expert game, false otherwise
      Returns:
      the controller created, null if the parameters are not supported

    • getOpeningController

      public Controller getOpeningController(int controllerID)
      The method getOpeningController finds the Controller with the given ID and returns it
      Parameters:
      controllerID - the ID of the controller to find
      Returns:
      the found controller, null if there is no Controller with the given ID

    • createNewRestoredGameController

      public RestoredGameController createNewRestoredGameController(String nickname, SavedGameData savedGameData) throws FileNotFoundException
      The method createNewRestoredGameController tries to restore the game represented by the given SavedGameData and to create the controller bound to it
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player that wants to restore the game
      savedGameData - the SavedGamaData that represents the game to be restored
      Returns:
      the newly created RestoredGameController bound to the restored game
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if there is no saved game represented by the given SavedGameData

    • registerNickname

      public void registerNickname(ClientHandler clientHandler, String nickname) throws NicknameNotAvailableException
      The method registerNickname associates the given nickname to the given ClientHandler if it is not already associated with another ClientHandler
      Parameters:
      clientHandler - the ClientHandler to which associate the given nickname
      nickname - the nickname to associate to the given ClientHandler
      Throws:
      NicknameNotAvailableException - if the given nickname is already associated with another ClientHandler

    • unregisterNickname

      public void unregisterNickname(ClientHandler clientHandler)
      The method unregisterNickname removes the association of the given ClientHandler with its nickname
      Parameters:
      clientHandler - the ClientHandler of which to remove the association with its nickname

    • getNicknameFromClientHandler

      The method getNicknameFromClientHandler returns the nickname associated with the given ClientHandler
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the nickname associated to the given ClientHandler

      public void startControllerGame(Controller controller)
      The method startControllerGame classifies the given Controller as one with a started game
      Parameters:
      controller - the Controller to be classified

      The method removeController removes all references of the given Controller in this object
